content:
Was just playing with Wire messenger. When sending disappearing/timed msgs the entire compose box changes from white to orange.
I think that would be perfect for Zulip to draw more attention to whether the user is writing/replying to a stream or PM...
Wouldn't have to be orange either. The compose background for PMs could be the same as PMs.

Wire-Msgr-Disappearing-msgs-change-compose-box-colour.gif
the gif I recorded from their (electron based) desktop app. I find it even more obvious on android but there I also have a low light colour scheme. The text of the msgs stay white.

another option:
Compose your message here

for a PM it could and should say: 'Compose your private message here'
for stream: 'Compose your stream message here'
but on the other hand there is already the bar with the email address for PM and stream/topic for such. This should really be enough but I guess it isn't.
When you say "I guess it isn't enough", can you explain more what you mean?

sure, one the one hand I think Zulip does a lot to make it obvious but then it still happens to lots of our people here that the just don't see it. Hence the 'I guess'. I'm trying to figure out the mental/psychological reasons why this might get overlooked so quickly. It happened to me as well. I had PM conversations in the stream. The focus is very quickly on the conversation and it's content rather than what it looks like I'm typing in.

Would something like "you have to press enter twice to send outside your current narrow" help? (E.g. by having to click through a "are you sure" popover)

I think making PMs and stream compose look more different is also totally reasonable, though I think this is problem extends even to sending stream messages to the wrong stream.

was just tinkering a bit
mockup

I don't actually like the orange
neither too much the black bar for PMs.
The left stream bar in blue would work and change it's colour with the stream that is being replied to.
the missing bar for PMs could make more aware that you are composing to PM
there is the element of human error which no programming will ever solve either.

mockup alternative
another version where the background of the compose box has the colour of the PM background whenever it's narrowed to a PM

i like the idea of flicking between a stream/PM styling for the compose box. it creates a clear link for the user & jumps at them and would also be useful for new users who are still figuring out the workflow.
